Module kivakit.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.traits

Interface LanguageTrait

All Superinterfaces:
Broadcaster, NamedObject, Receiver, Transceiver, Transmitter
All Known Subinterfaces:
Component, ComponentFunction<From,​To>, ComponentMixin, ComponentSupplier<Value>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Application, BaseComponent, Server
public interface LanguageTrait extends Broadcaster
Contains methods that substitute-for, or extend Java language features.

Functions

  • ifNonNullApply - Null-safe version of Function.apply()
  • ifNullDefault - The given value if it is non-null, the default value otherwise.

Messaging

  • isFalseOr - Broadcasts a Problem if the given value is not false
  • isTrueOr - Broadcasts a Problem if the given value is not true
  • isNonNullOr - Broadcasts a Problem if the given value is null

Function Examples

 applyIfNonNull(null, String::toLowerCase)   ==>   null
 applyIfNonNull("JL", String::toLowerCase)   ==>   "jl"

 nonNullOr(5, -1)     ==>   5
 nonNullOr(null, 5)   ==>   5

Messaging Examples

 String name = "bob";

 // This if-statement is the same as the following if/else statement.
 if (isNonNullOr(name, "A name must be provided"))
 {
     System.out.println("name = " + name);
 }

 if (name != null)
 {
     System.out.println("name = " + name);
 }
 else
 {
     problem("A name must be provided")
 }
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Details

    • ifNonNullApply

      default <In,​ Out> Out ifNonNullApply​(In value, Function<In,​Out> function)

      If the given value is null, this method returns null. Otherwise, it returns the value of the given function when it is applied to the given value. 

       var lowercase = applyIfNonNull(text, String::toLowerCase)
      Parameters:
      value - The value to check for null
      function - The function to apply if the value is non-null

    • ifNullDefault

      default <T> T ifNullDefault​(T value, T defaultValue)
      Returns the given value, but if the value is null, returns the defaultValue instead.
      Parameters:
      value - The provided value
      defaultValue - The default value to return if the value provided is null
      Returns:
      The given value if it is non-null, the default value otherwise.

    • isFalseOr

      default boolean isFalseOr​(boolean value, String message, Object... arguments)
      If the value is true, broadcasts the given message as a Problem.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to test
      message - The problem message
      arguments - Any arguments to apply when formatting the Problem message.
      Returns:
      True if the value is false, false if the value is true

    • isNonNullOr

      default boolean isNonNullOr​(Object value, String message, Object... arguments)
      If the value is null, broadcasts the given message as a Problem
      Parameters:
      value - The value to test
      message - The message to broadcast if the value is null
      arguments - Any arguments to apply when formatting the Problem message.
      Returns:
      True if the value is non-null, false if the value is null

    • isTrueOr

      default boolean isTrueOr​(boolean value, String message, Object... arguments)
      If the value is false, broadcasts the given message as a Problem.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to test
      message - The problem message
      arguments - Any arguments to apply when formatting the Problem message.
      Returns:
      True if the value is true
